results.title: Once upon a midnight scary
results.creator_credit: Neil Cox, Paul Asselin and Diane Asselin
results.brief_description: Welcome to the eerie library of Vincent Price, journey with him into a world of ghosts, ghouls and “things that go bump in the night”. The Master of macabre has conjured up a reading of classic and contemporary ghost stories that are vividly brought to life. There is mystery and wonder in these three famous tales of the supernatural. In Richard Peck’s “The Ghost Belonged to Me”, meet 13 year old Alexander, a farmboy who discovers he has his very own ghost! And see Ichabod Crane from Washington Irving’s classic “The Legend of Sleepy Hollow”, who doesn’t believe in ghosts - until the Headless Horseman takes his last ride. Then there’s John Bellair’s “The House With a Clock in its Walls”, where a doctor and his nephew race against an evil spirit to find a clock before it destroys the world.

results.title: Iwerre Atherrame: two paths
results.creator_credit: Kwementyaye (David) Vadiveloo, Australian Film Commission, Victorian College of the Arts and Achilles Heel
results.brief_description: The sometimes cruel but often beautiful landscape of Alice Springs is looked at from a different perspective in this confronting documentary. Focussing on four school children who have been rejected from the mainstream educational system, this film looks at the Detour Project, which is an alternative schooling initiative set up for Aboriginal children who have not benefitted form the education offered in the mainstream system. It offers a curriculum both in Arrente and English, it preserves the traditional language and culture of the people of Alice Springs and recognises the importance of culture, belonging and a sense of place. It is a journey of hope, simply told but with a savage twist.

results.title: Once upon a hunt [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: Francis Mankiewicz, Pierre Gauvreau and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This feature film is the story of three men and a boy who leave the city for the bush and a three-day hunt. For the hunters escaping the routine of daily life and work, the hunt is a move towards freedom. And above all, it is a chance to prove their virility in conquering the wild. Their attempts end in failure and tragedy. Cast includes Monique Mercure, Francoise Berd, Marcel Sabourin, Frederique Collin, Pierre Dufresne. Preview before screening for a general audience. Dubbed English version. (Award: Toronto)

results.title: Modern bread making
results.creator_credit: Jack Gardiner, Peter Whitchurch and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: The whole process of bread making in a highly mechanised factory. Weighing and mixing the ingredients, the bread rising, mechanical cutting, moulding and oil spraying of the loaves; baking, slicing, wrapping and despatch. Presented by the bakers of Tip Top Bread.

results.title: Once upon a forest [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Charles Grosvenor, Jerry Mills, David Kirschner, HTV Cymbu Wales, Zotic Fox and Hanna-Barbera Productions
results.brief_description: Dapplewood is a magical place. One day three Furling friends, Abagail the wood mouse, Edgar the mole and Russell the hedgehog find their lives seriously disrupted. A chemical spill threatens Dapplewood and their young friend Michelle becomes seriously ill from the toxic fumes. The three friends use the skills they learned from their teacher Cornelius and embark on an exciting journey to find help for their friend. From the famous Hanna-Barbera studios.

results.title: Model 621 Sound Projector with tripod and stand
results.credit_line: ACMI Collection. Tripod donated by Daryl Annett.
results.brief_description: In 1951, this projector was brought to the Koomooloo Station in South Australia to entertain workers during the shearing season.

constellations_primary.name: Bell & Howell Projector 621: This picture has been edited for content
constellations_primary.description: The Bell & Howell-Gaumont Model 621 projector was originally used entertain the shearers on a sheep farm in South Australia with the films screened sometimes edited for distribution.

results.title_for_label: Model 621 Sound Projector with tripod and stand
results.description: Though it was made in England, this projector made it over 15,000kms to the Koomooloo Station in South Australia. Situated on pastoral land in the Murray and Mellee region of South Australia, Koomooloo Station operated as a sheep station from 1868 and in 1951, this projector was bought to entertain workers during the shearing season. Luckily it has a vent at the back of the casing to keep it cool because if it was used inside a shearing shed the heat would’ve been insufferable.
description_for_label: Though it was made in England, this projector made it over 15,000kms to the Koomooloo Station in South Australia. results.title: Moby Dick
results.creator_credit: John Huston, Moulin Films, Warner Bros Pictures and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Huston had for a long time wanted to direct a version of Herman Melville’s classic novel. This superbly photographed epic features a thrilling performance by Gregory Peck as Captain Ahab, the man obsessed with killing the white whale which claimed his leg. The meticulous attention that Huston pays to the details of the sailors’ lives and work is an apt cinematic rendering of Melville’s realist prose. Though much maligned on its initial release, “Moby Dick” is now considered a flawed but magnificent achievement by one of America’s most famous directors. Also starring Richard Basehart and Orson Welles. The script was co-authored by Huston and Ray Bradbury.

results.title: Mobility
results.creator_credit: Roger Hart, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Examines the complex range of problems involved in Third World urban transport, from cost and available technology to the different needs of the industrialized middle class and the urban poor, and proposes some surprising solutions. This film explores how transportation planners and city governments try to solve the problems associated with the growth of cities, especially the increased pressure on existing transportation systems.

results.title: Mixed blood
results.creator_credit: Paul Morrissey, Steven Fierberg, Antoine Gannage and Sara Films
results.brief_description: Morrissey’s post-Warhol feature film about gang violence in New York’s Alphabet City. Marilia Pera is outstanding as the Brazilian leader of the Mercentanos gang. She is a drug-dealer and pimp, but also mother to a group of teenage boys who obey her every command, be it shooting a rival or doing the laundry. “Mixed Blood” is violent and disturbing but it maintains a comic tone throughout that refuses sentimentality and cliche. This is a drug “exploitation” movie scored to a festive, breezy Latin beat.

results.title: Mitosis: how cells divide and multiply
results.creator_credit: D.G. Perrin, A.S. Fraser and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Uses simple animation to show the essential changes in the nucleus leading up to its division into two daughter cells. Explains why each daughter cell contains the same number of chromosomes as the parent cell.
results.description: Uses simple animation to show the essential changes in the nucleus leading up to its division into two daughter cells. Explains why each daughter cell contains the same number of chromosomes as the parent cell.
